trailingComments.value:
*
 * Generate the dynamic external component registration hash based on the computed index.
 *
 * @param {Array} index Directory index of components, can be a subset.
 * @param {String} basePath Base path for components you want to register (empty by default).
 * @param {String} componentPath Current component path (used during recursion, empty by default).
 * @param {Object} components Current component registration hash (used during recursion, empty by default).
 * @returns {Object} Registration hash of found components where the key is the component name.

did not receive this file, see https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.txt.

*
 * Helper functions for dynamic external component registration.
 *
 * @module Apps/External/Helpers/ExternalComponentRegistration

*
 * Component index array is computed by webpack at the time of the app build.
 *
 * @const

*
 * Generate the dynamic external component registration hash based on the computed index.
 *
 * @param {Array} index Directory index of components, can be a subset.
 * @param {String} basePath Base path for components you want to register (empty by default).
 * @param {String} componentPath Current component path (used during recursion, empty by default).
 * @param {Object} components Current component registration hash (used during recursion, empty by default).
 * @returns {Object} Registration hash of found components where the key is the component name.
Consider only Vue components and subdirectories.
For components named `index`, get the name of the parent folder, and shorten the path accordingly.
Skip components which do not reside in the specified base path.
Define lazy loaded components registration. Webpack will make sure that all shared components will be
chunked properly because of variable placeholders in the import path.

*
 * Get the dynamic external component registration hash.
 *
 * @param {String} basePath Base path for components you want to register (empty by default).
 * @returns {Object} Registration hash of found components where the key is the component name.
Remove any superfluous prefix in the base path.

*
 * Helper functions for dynamic external component registration.
 *
 * @module Apps/External/Helpers/ExternalComponentRegistration

*
 * Component index array is computed by webpack at the time of the app build.
 *
 * @const

*
 * Generate the dynamic external component registration hash based on the computed index.
 *
 * @param {Array} index Directory index of components, can be a subset.
 * @param {String} basePath Base path for components you want to register (empty by default).
 * @param {String} componentPath Current component path (used during recursion, empty by default).
 * @param {Object} components Current component registration hash (used during recursion, empty by default).
 * @returns {Object} Registration hash of found components where the key is the component name.
Consider only Vue components and subdirectories.
For components named `index`, get the name of the parent folder, and shorten the path accordingly.
Skip components which do not reside in the specified base path.
Define lazy loaded components registration. Webpack will make sure that all shared components will be
chunked properly because of variable placeholders in the import path.

*
 * Get the dynamic external component registration hash.
 *
 * @param {String} basePath Base path for components you want to register (empty by default).
 * @returns {Object} Registration hash of found components where the key is the component name.
Remove any superfluous prefix in the base path.
